Text: It is normal, an abstract class can't be constructed . Then it is impossible to construct it. When you write public class MyTable extends DBTable The compiler executs the herited methods. Test without super(); I think it may work. Friendly PS : I'm French and can more easily explan you this mechanism in my language. You can write me at marc.richard@ubiprocess.fr

It is normal, an abstract class can't be constructed . Then it is impossible to construct it. When you write `public class MyTable extends DBTable`, the compiler executes the inherited methods. Test without super(); I think it may work.
